content: Hello Mister Heine, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Mannheim. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Thank you for your interest in the apartment, Mr. Müller. I think we can come to an agreement on the rental price. Based on the size and location of the apartment, I would propose a monthly rental of 800 Euros. This price reflects the market value of similar apartments in the area and should be sufficient to cover my costs and provide a reasonable profit margin. What do you think?
name: Heinrich Heine

content: I agree to the price of 800 Euros per month. Thank you for the opportunity to rent the apartment. I will sign the lease agreement as soon as possible.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Excellent! I'm glad we could come to an agreement. The lease agreement will be sent to your email address for you to review and sign. Once you sign, you will have a legally binding contract that outlines the terms and conditions of the rental. Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns. I look forward to having you as a tenant!
name: Heinrich Heine

content:
I have a question. If I need to make any repairs to the apartment, who is responsible for the costs?

I agree to pay the monthly rental of 800 Euros per month, but I want to know who is responsible for any repairs that need to be made to the apartment.

Please let me know.

Thank you.

Max Müller

---

Dear Mister Heine,

I hope this email finds you well. Thank you for inviting me to see the apartment in Mannheim. I am interested in renting the apartment, but I have a question about the responsibility for repairs.

Can you please clarify who is responsible for any repairs that need to be made to the apartment? I want to make sure that I understand my rights and responsibilities as a tenant.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,

Max Müller
name: Max Müller from Germany

content:
Dear Max,

Thank you for your email. I understand that you would like clarification on the responsibility for repairs.

As the landlord, I am responsible for maintaining the structure and major systems of the apartment, such as the plumbing, electrical, and heating systems. However, minor repairs that are the result of normal wear and tear, such as fixing a broken faucet or replacing a light bulb, would be the responsibility of the tenant.

If you require any major repairs or renovations, I would be happy to discuss the costs and arrangement with you. Please let me know if you have any further questions or concerns.

Thank you for your interest in the apartment.

Best regards,

Heinrich Heine
name: Heinrich Heine
